qas.question: In whose cadidacy did the immediate cause of war reside?
What did France fear by an alliance between Prussia and Spain?
Who goaded the French into war by editing a telegram sent by William I?
What was the name of the famous telelgram?
What was the reaction of the French people to the deceptively crafted offense in the Ems Dispatch?

context: The immediate cause of the war resided in the candidacy of a <a0_0>Leopold of Hohenzollern-Sigmaringen<a0_0/>, a Prussian prince, to the throne of Spain. France feared <a1_0>encirclement<a1_0/> by an alliance between Prussia and Spain. The Hohenzollern prince's candidacy was withdrawn under French diplomatic pressure, but <a2_0>Otto von Bismarck<a2_0/> goaded the French into declaring war by altering a telegram sent by William I. Releasing the <a3_0>Ems Dispatch<a3_0/> to the public, Bismarck made it sound as if the king had treated the French envoy in a demeaning fashion, which <a4_0>inflamed public opinion<a4_0/> in France.
